150 /**

152  *

161 /**
162  * GUnicodeBreakType:
163  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_MANDATORY: Mandatory Break (BK)
164  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_CARRIAGE_RETURN: Carriage Return (CR)
165  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_LINE_FEED: Line Feed (LF)
166  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_COMBINING_MARK: Attached Characters and Combining Marks (CM)
167  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_SURROGATE: Surrogates (SG)
168  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_ZERO_WIDTH_SPACE: Zero Width Space (ZW)
169  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_INSEPARABLE: Inseparable (IN)
170  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_NON_BREAKING_GLUE: Non-breaking ("Glue") (GL)
171  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_CONTINGENT: Contingent Break Opportunity (CB)
172  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_SPACE: Space (SP)
173  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_AFTER: Break Opportunity After (BA)
174  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_BEFORE: Break Opportunity Before (BB)
175  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_BEFORE_AND_AFTER: Break Opportunity Before and After (B2)
176  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_HYPHEN: Hyphen (HY)
177  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_NON_STARTER: Nonstarter (NS)
178  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_OPEN_PUNCTUATION: Opening Punctuation (OP)
179  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_CLOSE_PUNCTUATION: Closing Punctuation (CL)

405  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MULTANI:              Multani. Since: 2.48
406  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_OLD_HUNGARIAN:        Old Hungarian. Since: 2.48
407  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_SIGNWRITING:          Signwriting. Since: 2.48
408  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_ADLAM:                Adlam. Since: 2.50
409  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_BHAIKSUKI:            Bhaiksuki. Since: 2.50
410  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MARCHEN:              Marchen. Since: 2.50
411  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_NEWA:                 Newa. Since: 2.50
412  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_OSAGE:                Osage. Since: 2.50
413  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_TANGUT:               Tangut. Since: 2.50
414  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MASARAM_GONDI:        Masaram Gondi. Since: 2.54
415  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_NUSHU:                Nushu. Since: 2.54
416  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_SOYOMBO:              Soyombo. Since: 2.54
417  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_ZANABAZAR_SQUARE:     Zanabazar Square. Since: 2.54
418  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_DOGRA:                Dogra. Since: 2.58
419  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_GUNJALA_GONDI:        Gunjala Gondi. Since: 2.58
420  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_HANIFI_ROHINGYA:      Hanifi Rohingya. Since: 2.58
421  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MAKASAR:              Makasar. Since: 2.58
422  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MEDEFAIDRIN:          Medefaidrin. Since: 2.58
423  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_OLD_SOGDIAN:          Old Sogdian. Since: 2.58
424  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_SOGDIAN:              Sogdian. Since: 2.58




425  *
426  * The #GUnicodeScript enumeration identifies different writing
427  * systems. The values correspond to the names as defined in the
428  * Unicode standard. The enumeration has been added in GLib 2.14,
429  * and is interchangeable with #PangoScript.
430  *
431  * Note that new types may be added in the future. Applications
432  * should be ready to handle unknown values.
433  * See [Unicode Standard Annex #24: Script names](http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr24/).
434  */
435 typedef enum
436 {                         /* ISO 15924 code */
437   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_INVALID_CODE = -1,
438   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_COMMON       = 0,   /* Zyyy */
439   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_INHERITED,          /* Zinh (Qaai) */
440   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_ARABIC,             /* Arab */
441   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_ARMENIAN,           /* Armn */
442   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_BENGALI,            /* Beng */
443   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_BOPOMOFO,           /* Bopo */
444   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_CHEROKEE,           /* Cher */

546 
547   /* Unicode-6.1 additions */
548   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_CHAKMA,                 /* Cakm */
549   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MEROITIC_CURSIVE,       /* Merc */
550   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MEROITIC_HIEROGLYPHS,   /* Mero */
551   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MIAO,                   /* Plrd */
552   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_SHARADA,                /* Shrd */
553   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_SORA_SOMPENG,           /* Sora */
554   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_TAKRI,                  /* Takr */
555 
556   /* Unicode 7.0 additions */
557   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_BASSA_VAH,              /* Bass */
558   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_CAUCASIAN_ALBANIAN,     /* Aghb */
559   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_DUPLOYAN,               /* Dupl */
560   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_ELBASAN,                /* Elba */
561   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_GRANTHA,                /* Gran */
562   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_KHOJKI,                 /* Khoj */
563   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_KHUDAWADI,              /* Sind */
564   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_LINEAR_A,               /* Lina */
565   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MAHAJANI,               /* Mahj */
566   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MANICHAEAN,             /* Manu */
567   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MENDE_KIKAKUI,          /* Mend */
568   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MODI,                   /* Modi */
569   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MRO,                    /* Mroo */
570   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_NABATAEAN,              /* Nbat */
571   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_OLD_NORTH_ARABIAN,      /* Narb */
572   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_OLD_PERMIC,             /* Perm */
573   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_PAHAWH_HMONG,           /* Hmng */
574   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_PALMYRENE,              /* Palm */
575   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_PAU_CIN_HAU,            /* Pauc */
576   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_PSALTER_PAHLAVI,        /* Phlp */
577   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_SIDDHAM,                /* Sidd */
578   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_TIRHUTA,                /* Tirh */
579   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_WARANG_CITI,            /* Wara */
580 
581   /* Unicode 8.0 additions */
582   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_AHOM,                   /* Ahom */
583   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_ANATOLIAN_HIEROGLYPHS,  /* Hluw */
584   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_HATRAN,                 /* Hatr */
585   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MULTANI,                /* Mult */
586   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_OLD_HUNGARIAN,          /* Hung */

590   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_ADLAM,                  /* Adlm */
591   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_BHAIKSUKI,              /* Bhks */
592   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MARCHEN,                /* Marc */
593   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_NEWA,                   /* Newa */
594   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_OSAGE,                  /* Osge */
595   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_TANGUT,                 /* Tang */
596 
597   /* Unicode 10.0 additions */
598   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MASARAM_GONDI,          /* Gonm */
599   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_NUSHU,                  /* Nshu */
600   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_SOYOMBO,                /* Soyo */
601   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_ZANABAZAR_SQUARE,       /* Zanb */
602 
603   /* Unicode 11.0 additions */
604   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_DOGRA,                  /* Dogr */
605   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_GUNJALA_GONDI,          /* Gong */
606   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_HANIFI_ROHINGYA,        /* Rohg */
607   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MAKASAR,                /* Maka */
608   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MEDEFAIDRIN,            /* Medf */
609   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_OLD_SOGDIAN,            /* Sogo */
610   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_SOGDIAN                 /* Sogd */






611 } GUnicodeScript;

861 /**
862  * GNormalizeMode:
863  * @G_NORMALIZE_DEFAULT: standardize differences that do not affect the
864  *     text content, such as the above-mentioned accent representation
865  * @G_NORMALIZE_NFD: another name for %G_NORMALIZE_DEFAULT
866  * @G_NORMALIZE_DEFAULT_COMPOSE: like %G_NORMALIZE_DEFAULT, but with
867  *     composed forms rather than a maximally decomposed form
868  * @G_NORMALIZE_NFC: another name for %G_NORMALIZE_DEFAULT_COMPOSE
869  * @G_NORMALIZE_ALL: beyond %G_NORMALIZE_DEFAULT also standardize the

137   G_UNICODE_FINAL_PUNCTUATION,

143   G_UNICODE_MATH_SYMBOL,

159 /**
160  * GUnicodeBreakType:
161  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_MANDATORY: Mandatory Break (BK)
162  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_CARRIAGE_RETURN: Carriage Return (CR)
163  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_LINE_FEED: Line Feed (LF)
164  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_COMBINING_MARK: Attached Characters and Combining Marks (CM)
165  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_SURROGATE: Surrogates (SG)
166  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_ZERO_WIDTH_SPACE: Zero Width Space (ZW)
167  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_INSEPARABLE: Inseparable (IN)
168  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_NON_BREAKING_GLUE: Non-breaking ("Glue") (GL)
169  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_CONTINGENT: Contingent Break Opportunity (CB)
170  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_SPACE: Space (SP)
171  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_AFTER: Break Opportunity After (BA)
172  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_BEFORE: Break Opportunity Before (BB)
173  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_BEFORE_AND_AFTER: Break Opportunity Before and After (B2)
174  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_HYPHEN: Hyphen (HY)
175  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_NON_STARTER: Nonstarter (NS)
176  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_OPEN_PUNCTUATION: Opening Punctuation (OP)
177  * @G_UNICODE_BREAK_CLOSE_PUNCTUATION: Closing Punctuation (CL)

403  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MULTANI:              Multani. Since: 2.48
404  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_OLD_HUNGARIAN:        Old Hungarian. Since: 2.48
405  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_SIGNWRITING:          Signwriting. Since: 2.48
406  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_ADLAM:                Adlam. Since: 2.50
407  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_BHAIKSUKI:            Bhaiksuki. Since: 2.50
408  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MARCHEN:              Marchen. Since: 2.50
409  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_NEWA:                 Newa. Since: 2.50
410  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_OSAGE:                Osage. Since: 2.50
411  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_TANGUT:               Tangut. Since: 2.50
412  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MASARAM_GONDI:        Masaram Gondi. Since: 2.54
413  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_NUSHU:                Nushu. Since: 2.54
414  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_SOYOMBO:              Soyombo. Since: 2.54
415  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_ZANABAZAR_SQUARE:     Zanabazar Square. Since: 2.54
416  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_DOGRA:                Dogra. Since: 2.58
417  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_GUNJALA_GONDI:        Gunjala Gondi. Since: 2.58
418  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_HANIFI_ROHINGYA:      Hanifi Rohingya. Since: 2.58
419  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MAKASAR:              Makasar. Since: 2.58
420  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_MEDEFAIDRIN:          Medefaidrin. Since: 2.58
421  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_OLD_SOGDIAN:          Old Sogdian. Since: 2.58
422  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_SOGDIAN:              Sogdian. Since: 2.58
423  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_ELYMAIC:              Elym. Since: 2.62
424  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_NANDINAGARI:          Nand. Since: 2.62
425  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_NYIAKENG_PUACHUE_HMONG: Rohg. Since: 2.62
426  * @G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_WANCHO:               Wcho. Since: 2.62
427  *
428  * The #GUnicodeScript enumeration identifies different writing
429  * systems. The values correspond to the names as defined in the
430  * Unicode standard. The enumeration has been added in GLib 2.14,
431  * and is interchangeable with #PangoScript.
432  *
433  * Note that new types may be added in the future. Applications
434  * should be ready to handle unknown values.
435  * See [Unicode Standard Annex #24: Script names](http://www.unicode.org/reports/tr24/).
436  */
437 typedef enum
438 {                         /* ISO 15924 code */
439   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_INVALID_CODE = -1,
440   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_COMMON       = 0,   /* Zyyy */
441   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_INHERITED,          /* Zinh (Qaai) */
442   G_UNICODE_SCRIPT_ARABIC,             /* Arab */

861                               const gchar **end);

863 GLIB_AVAILABLE_IN_ALL
864 gchar *g_utf8_strup   (const gchar *str,
865                        gssize       len) G_GNUC_MALLOC;
866 GLIB_AVAILABLE_IN_ALL
867 gchar *g_utf8_strdown (const gchar *str,
868                        gssize       len) G_GNUC_MALLOC;
869 GLIB_AVAILABLE_IN_ALL
870 gchar *g_utf8_casefold (const gchar *str,
871                         gssize       len) G_GNUC_MALLOC;
872 
873 /**
874  * GNormalizeMode:
875  * @G_NORMALIZE_DEFAULT: standardize differences that do not affect the
876  *     text content, such as the above-mentioned accent representation
877  * @G_NORMALIZE_NFD: another name for %G_NORMALIZE_DEFAULT
878  * @G_NORMALIZE_DEFAULT_COMPOSE: like %G_NORMALIZE_DEFAULT, but with
879  *     composed forms rather than a maximally decomposed form
880  * @G_NORMALIZE_NFC: another name for %G_NORMALIZE_DEFAULT_COMPOSE
881  * @G_NORMALIZE_ALL: beyond %G_NORMALIZE_DEFAULT also standardize the
< prev index next >
